title.narrative: Regional virtual platform on gender methodologies

description.narrative: This project tries to benefit social organisations working with gender perspective and on gender based violence prevention, facilitating a virtual space for reflection, and experiences and knowledge exchange. With this dynamic, they will have methodological tools, they will broaden their theoretical-conceptual framework and they will strengthen their advocacy actions in favor of a more just and equal society, without gender based violence. The project is aimed at civil society organizations, universities and social agents that promote changes towards gender equity in Central America. First, a Virtual Platform will be installed, its range of scope will be established and there will be people trained for its efficient operation. Second, the integration as active members will be motivated to all those organizations that raised this initiative as an urgent need in the Central American Meeting "Women and men walking towards gender equity", convened by Cantera in September 2017, among which are the member organizations of the Network for Equity and Gender Equality (RPEIG) of Nicaragua, different organizations that work on the issue of equity and non-violence in the country, organizations of the sister countries of Central America, counterparts of cooperation agencies that work at an intense level for gender equality and non-violence. CANTERA will enable the virtual space by sharing information about participating organizations and providing inputs to encourage dialogue, debate and reflection. Once installed, forums and research will be promoted, as well as alliances at the local, national or regional level for mass dissemination of gender equality campaigns and the prevention of gender violence. Third, it will be open to other organizations or institutions interested in the subject in order to strengthen themselves more and more in the diversity of contributions, knowledge and experiences.
